ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: We learned about journalism, yes, but we also learned about Italian culture, and mostly politics. I loved all the movies we watched, they are a great way to learn about culture/journalism from an Italian perspective.
I recommend this course--Prof. Iacovella is lovely and it's a really fun way to look at culture.

Take the class!! It is not very hard and you will enjoy it a lot! You will learn about Italy&Italians through the eyes of the journalists. You will also improve your writing and communicating skills! A very good class choice :)

I enjoyed the course. It was a great way to continue my Italian while learning something new about Italian culture. The workload was always manageable, and I really enjoyed being forced to peruse through Italian news each week, particularly since that's one of the main ways I can stay in touch with the country. But really, the course is definitely secondary to Professor Iacovella- she was much more crucial to making the course enjoyable than the syllabus or subject matter. She even took us out to an Italian pizzeria which was quite lovely.
